game_model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game_model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board Class creates the game and makes it playable. The constructor sets the size and theme, and calls methods to build the board and run the logic.
    • Board() This is the constructor, sets the difficulty and theme.
    • buildGameboard() Shuffles the cards and sets up the game on the GUI.
    • scanBoard() Runs the game logic and displays win and lose messages.

    • Field Summary

      • gameboard

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(java.lang.String board_size,
             java.lang.String theme)
        Board Class constructor decides the parameters of the game board. Constructor takes in 2 strings for the size of the game board and theme. Compares the size in three if statements and sizes the board accordingly. Reads and sets the theme, then calls the buildGameBoard method.
        Parameters:
        board_size - is the user selected difficulty of the game.
        theme - is the user selected theme of the card images.

    • Method Detail

      • buildGameboard

        public void buildGameboard(Card[] cards)
        buildGameboard method constructs the game and shuffles the cards. This method initializes the cards randomly to the buttons of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        cards - is an array of card objects from the Card class.

      • scanBoard

        public void scanBoard(int x_coordinate,
                      int y_coordinate,
                      javax.swing.JButton button)
        scanBoard method compares the the buttons clicked to see if they are a match. This is the method that actually makes the game playable. It also keeps track of the win and lose conditions and displays a dialog box upon winning or losing.
        Parameters:
        x_coordinate - is the x location of the array button.
        y_coordinate - is the y location of the array button.
        button - is each instance of the JButton on the GUI.
